verbs.description: overprove (third-person singular simple present overproves, present participle overproving, simple past overproved, past participle overproved or overproven)

entries.meaning: (transitive) to prove excessively or beyond what is asked or required
examples: I think many of his devices are, in fact, quite arbitrary; that he betrays a Germanic ponderousness at times and a tendency to overprove what is quite clear in the first place.
